event_type.category: Major Tournament Results and Championship Outcomes

events.summary: A regional youth swimming championship concluded at an indoor aquatic center with a 16-year-old competitor lowering the meet record in the 200-meter freestyle by 0.4 seconds, contributing to the overall team title for a mixed-age development squad.

outline.sentence: The {Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship|EVENT-1} concluded on 2025-07-12 at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} in {Bellwick|LOCATION-1}.
The final session closed shortly after 6:30 p.m., with roughly 380 spectators in attendance at the {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1}'s 50-meter competition pool.

{Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}, age 16, lowered the meet record in the 200-meter freestyle by 0.4 seconds with a time of 1:59.86 in the championship final at the {Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship|EVENT-1}.
The previous meet record of 2:00.26 had been set in 2018, and the official timing showed {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} touching the wall 0.35 seconds ahead of the second-place swimmer in the final.

The performance by {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} contributed directly to {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} securing the overall team title at the {Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship|EVENT-1}.
{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} finished the meet with 412 team points, clinching the title by a 28-point margin over the second-place team in a field of 18 squads.

Coach {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} of {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} said, "{Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} executed the race plan we practiced and her second-half pace sealed the finish," following the final at the {Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship|EVENT-1}.

Coach {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} added that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} produced a negative split—covering the second 100 meters in 59.20 seconds—and credited targeted 8x100 race-pace sets in training for the strong finish.

{Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship|EVENT-1} officials updated the official meet results to record {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s new 200-meter freestyle meet record set at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1}.

Officials posted an updated results PDF to the championship website within an hour and forwarded {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s time to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} for formal ratification of the new meet record.

continuation.summary: The Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation formally ratified Sera Lortin's 1:59.86 on 2025-07-16 and announced a small honorarium plus a one-on-one evaluation with the federation's under-17 head coach, with any wider camp invitations to be decided after that review.

events.summary: The Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation formally ratified Sera Lortin's 1:59.86 on 2025-07-16 and announced a small honorarium plus a one-on-one evaluation with the federation's under-17 head coach, with any wider camp invitations to be decided after that review.

outline.sentence: The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} formally ratified {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s 1:59.86 time in the 200-meter freestyle on 2025-07-16.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} issued a formal ratification letter signed by the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} secretary and updated the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s official performance database to record the 1:59.86 time as effective 2025-07-16.
The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} announced a small honorarium to be paid to {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} in recognition of the ratified performance.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} said the honorarium is a one-time payment intended to defray travel and incidental expenses, that the payment will be processed via {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1}'s administrative account, and that a remittance notification will be issued to {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} within 14 days.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} scheduled a one-on-one evaluation between {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} and {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}, the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} under-17 head coach, for 2025-07-22.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} scheduled the evaluation to take place at the Valemont Sports Council Building's coaching office and assessment pool and allotted a 45-minute slot comprising a 20-minute in-pool technical review, a 15-minute video stroke analysis, and a 10-minute discussion of recent training history.
{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} confirmed that {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} will accompany {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} to the one-on-one evaluation with {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} stated that {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} will bring {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s recent training log, official race split sheets from the championship, and a short written summary of the team's 8x100 race-pace sets for review during the evaluation.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} stated that the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} selection committee will decide on any wider camp invitations after the evaluation with {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} added that the selection committee intends to review {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}'s written evaluation within 72 hours and will apply the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s published under-17 selection criteria, including objective time thresholds, technical assessment, and coach recommendations, when determining any invitations to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s development camp.

continuation.summary: On 2025-07-22 Nadia Varnell completed the scheduled 45-minute evaluation of Sera Lortin and submitted a written recommendation that, while Sera's second-half pacing is a clear strength, she be offered a focused two-week regional skills clinic rather than immediate development-camp placement to refine specific technical elements first.

events.summary: On 2025-07-22 Nadia Varnell completed the scheduled 45-minute evaluation of Sera Lortin and submitted a written recommendation that, while Sera's second-half pacing is a clear strength, she be offered a focused two-week regional skills clinic rather than immediate development-camp placement to refine specific technical elements first.

outline.sentence: On 2025-07-22 {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3} completed the scheduled 45-minute evaluation of {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} at the Valemont Sports Council Building.

The evaluation began at 10:00 a.m. and concluded at 10:45 a.m., with {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3} conducting timed short-pace sets in lane three of the Valemont Sports Council Building assessment pool while a portable high-frame-rate camera recorded {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s stroke for later review.
{Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}'s written assessment noted that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s second-half pacing is a clear competitive strength.

{Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}'s written assessment included measured session data, citing three coached 50m closing efforts with an average split differential of roughly 0.15 seconds faster on the closing 50m as evidence of {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s reliable race-closing speed.

{Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3} recommended that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} be offered a focused two-week regional skills clinic rather than immediate placement in the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} development camp.

In the recommendation {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3} specified the clinic should prioritize starts and turns, catch-phase refinement, and daily coached video review accompanied by prescribed dryland core-strength sessions across the two-week period.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} acknowledged receipt of {Nadia Varnell|PERSON-3}'s written recommendation and confirmed that {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} will coordinate next steps with the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} stated it would confirm {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s availability, provide the athlete's medical clearance and travel preferences, and aim to forward formal participation confirmation to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} within 48 hours.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} scheduled the two-week regional skills clinic at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} to run from 2025-08-05 to 2025-08-18 and asked {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} to provide participant logistics for {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} requested that {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} supply {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s arrival time, emergency contact, and any dietary or accommodation needs by 2025-07-28, and noted the clinic will run morning and late-afternoon pool sessions with an on-site classroom reserved for daily video analysis.

continuation.summary: Merrowgate Development Squad informed the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation that Sera Lortin has a minor shoulder complaint but requested she be allowed to attend the 2025-08-05 regional skills clinic for classroom and video-review sessions only, deferring in-pool training pending reassessment.

events.summary: Merrowgate Development Squad informed the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation that Sera Lortin has a minor shoulder complaint but requested she be allowed to attend the 2025-08-05 regional skills clinic for classroom and video-review sessions only, deferring in-pool training pending reassessment.

outline.sentence: {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} notified the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} on 2025-07-28 that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} has reported a minor shoulder complaint.

The notification was sent in a 10:15 a.m. email from {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1}'s administrative officer to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s selection coordinator and described the issue as minor left-shoulder tenderness that first materialized after a timed interval set on 2025-07-25 and has been managed with ice and modified training since then.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} requested that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} be permitted to attend the 2025-08-05 regional skills clinic for classroom and video-review sessions only, deferring {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s in-pool training pending reassessment.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1}'s request specified that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} would attend only non-pool activities including daily video-review sessions in the clinic classroom and prescribed dryland/core-strength work supervised by {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} staff, and that {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} offered to have its physiotherapist available for on-site reassessment if required by the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} acknowledged {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1}'s request and stated the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} requires a clinician's medical clearance before approving {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s classroom-only participation.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s acknowledgement, issued by email from the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s selection coordinator, specified that the required clinician's medical clearance must be provided in writing by an accredited sports physician or chartered physiotherapist and include a clinical diagnosis, current functional limitations, and any recommended restrictions for the clinic period.

{Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} confirmed that {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} will accompany {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} to the clinic and that {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} will submit {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s medical clearance and arrival information to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} by 2025-07-30.

In his confirmation {Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} stated he would act as {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s team guardian at the clinic, provided a provisional arrival time of the evening of 2025-08-04, supplied a direct mobile contact for emergency use, and said the {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} submission on 2025-07-30 would include the clinician's clearance document and {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s accommodation preference.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} asked {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} to reserve the on-site classroom for {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s video-review sessions pending receipt of the required medical clearance from {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1}.

{Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} placed a provisional hold on the clinic classroom for the 2025-08-05 to 2025-08-18 period and confirmed the room's AV setup includes a ceiling-mounted projector and a laptop playback station compatible with high-frame-rate video files, with seating arranged for up to 20 people pending the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s final approval.

continuation.summary: On 2025-08-04 evening, following an on-site reassessment at Brindemoor, Merrowgate's physiotherapist issued a same-day written clearance restricting Sera Lortin to classroom and dryland sessions only, and the Federation approved her conditional classroom-only attendance under daily on-site physiotherapy monitoring and a no-pool restriction.

events.summary: On 2025-08-04 evening, following an on-site reassessment at Brindemoor, Merrowgate's physiotherapist issued a same-day written clearance restricting Sera Lortin to classroom and dryland sessions only, and the Federation approved her conditional classroom-only attendance under daily on-site physiotherapy monitoring and a no-pool restriction.

outline.sentence: {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} physiotherapist {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4} conducted an on-site reassessment of {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} on the evening of 2025-08-04.

The reassessment began at approximately 19:10 local time, lasted about 25 minutes, and included recorded range-of-motion measurements, resisted shoulder tests and a documented pain-on-load rating of 4/10 for the left shoulder.

{Rowan Myles|PERSON-4} issued a same-day written medical clearance restricting {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} to classroom and dryland sessions only and advising that {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} must not undertake in-pool activity for the clinic period.

The same-day written clearance, signed and dated by {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4}, specified a provisional diagnosis of left subacromial tendinopathy, a no-pool restriction for the two-week clinic period, and recommended supervised rotator-cuff strengthening and twice-daily ice as part of the dryland programme.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} forwarded {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4}'s written medical clearance to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} by email on the evening of 2025-08-04; {Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} had previously aimed to submit clearance by 2025-07-30 but scheduling required the physiotherapist reassessment to occur on 2025-08-04, so the clearance was sent same-day after that assessment.

{Merrowgate Development Squad|ORGANIZATION-1} sent the clearance as a PDF attachment titled "{S_Lortin_Clearance_20250804.pdf|MISCELLANEOUS-1}" in a 20:03 email to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} selection coordinator and included {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4}'s direct mobile number for same-day follow-up.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} approved conditional classroom-only attendance for {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} under the requirement of daily on-site physiotherapy monitoring by {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4} and a strict no-pool restriction.

The {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s approval email, issued at 21:14, added that {Rowan Myles|PERSON-4} must conduct a brief pre-class check each morning, provide a one-line written progress note to the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} after each monitoring session, and immediately notify the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2} if {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}'s symptoms worsened.

{Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} arrived at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} on the evening of 2025-08-04 to act as team guardian for {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1} and to coordinate on-site physiotherapy monitoring arrangements with the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}.

{Ivo Harlen|PERSON-2} checked in at {Brindemoor Aquatic Complex|BUILDING-1} reception at about 20:30, provided a local emergency contact for {Sera Lortin|PERSON-1}, and confirmed by phone with the {Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation|ORGANIZATION-2}'s selection coordinator that physiotherapy monitoring would commence with an 08:15 check on 2025-08-05.

continuation.summary: The Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation issued a 2025-07-30 remittance notification confirming the honorarium was processed to Merrowgate Development Squad's administrative account for Sera Lortin, subject to routine verification which will hold disbursement from the club account until the club confirms beneficiary bank details.

event.description: An annual regional youth swimming competition that brings together clubs across the Carterline area for multi-session age-group racing and qualification opportunities.

history.event_update: The Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship concluded on 2025-07-12 at Brindemoor Aquatic Complex; the final session closed shortly after 6:30 p.m., with roughly 380 spectators in attendance at the 50-meter competition pool.

person.name: Sera Lortin
person.description: Sera Lortin is a disciplined and goal-oriented young athlete known for meticulous race preparation and a pragmatic, improvement-focused mindset.

history.event_update: Sera Lortin (age 16) set a new meet record in the 200-meter freestyle with a time of 1:59.86, touched 0.35 seconds ahead of the runner-up, produced a 59.20s second 100m (negative split), and helped Merrowgate Development Squad secure the overall team title.

Sera Lortin had her 1:59.86 time in the 200-meter freestyle formally ratified by the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation effective 2025-07-16; the Federation announced a one-time honorarium to be paid via Merrowgate Development Squad's administrative account and scheduled her one-on-one evaluation with under-17 head coach Nadia Varnell for 2025-07-22 (Ivo Harlen to accompany).

Sera Lortin completed the scheduled 45-minute evaluation with Nadia Varnell on 2025-07-22 at the Valemont Sports Council Building and is the athlete recommended for the two-week regional skills clinic.

person.name: Ivo Harlen
person.description: Ivo Harlen is a methodical and pragmatic coach who emphasizes technique, measurable progress, and individualized training plans.

history.event_update: Ivo Harlen, head coach of Merrowgate Development Squad, led the team at the championship, credited targeted 8x100 race-pace training for Sera Lortin's strong second-half performance, and provided post-race comments on the execution of the race plan.

Ivo Harlen confirmed he will accompany Sera Lortin to the one-on-one evaluation on 2025-07-22 and will bring Sera's recent training log, official race split sheets from the championship, and a short written summary of the team's 8x100 race-pace sets for review.
Ivo Harlen was confirmed by Merrowgate Development Squad to coordinate next steps with the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation and to accompany Sera Lortin following the 2025-07-22 evaluation.

person.name: Nadia Varnell
person.description: Nadia Varnell is a focused and analytical youth coach who prioritizes technical development, athlete wellbeing, and clear progression pathways for young competitors.

history.event_update: Nadia Varnell is scheduled to conduct a 45-minute one-on-one evaluation of Sera Lortin on 2025-07-22 at the Valemont Sports Council Building (20-minute in-pool technical review, 15-minute video stroke analysis, 10-minute training discussion) and will provide a written evaluation to the selection committee to be reviewed within 72 hours.

Nadia Varnell conducted the 45-minute one-on-one evaluation of Sera Lortin on 2025-07-22, produced a written assessment noting strong second-half pacing, and recommended a focused two-week regional skills clinic with specified technical and video-review priorities.

organization.name: Merrowgate Development Squad

history.event_update: Merrowgate Development Squad won the overall team title at the Carterline Regional Youth Swimming Championship, finishing with 412 team points and clinching the title by a 28-point margin over the second-place team in a field of 18 squads.

Merrowgate Development Squad confirmed that its administrative account will be used to process the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation's one-time honorarium payment to Sera Lortin and that Ivo Harlen will accompany Sera to the scheduled evaluation on 2025-07-22.

Merrowgate Development Squad acknowledged receipt of Nadia Varnell's written recommendation, confirmed Ivo Harlen will coordinate next steps, and stated it will confirm Sera Lortin's availability, provide medical clearance and travel preferences, and aim to forward formal participation confirmation within 48 hours.

history.event_update: Sera Lortin (age 16) set a new meet record in the 200-meter freestyle with a time of 1:59.86, touched 0.35 seconds ahead of the runner-up, produced a 59.20s second 100m (negative split), and helped Merrowgate Development Squad secure the overall team title.

Sera Lortin was reassessed on-site by physiotherapist Rowan Myles at Brindemoor Aquatic Complex on the evening of 2025-08-04 (assessment began ≈19:10, ~25 minutes); the assessment recorded range-of-motion measurements, resisted shoulder tests and a pain-on-load rating of 4/10, and Rowan issued a same-day written medical clearance restricting Sera to classroom and dryland sessions only (no in-pool activity) with a provisional diagnosis of left subacromial tendinopathy; the Carterline Regional Aquatics Federation subsequently approved conditional classroom-only attendance requiring daily on-site physiotherapy monitoring.

Ivo Harlen arrived at Brindemoor Aquatic Complex on the evening of 2025-08-04 to act as team guardian for Sera Lortin, checked in at reception at about 20:30, provided a local emergency contact for Sera, and confirmed by phone with the Federation's selection coordinator that physiotherapy monitoring would commence with an 08:15 check on 2025-08-05.

person.name: Rowan Myles
person.description: Rowan Myles is a pragmatic and meticulous sports physiotherapist who prioritizes evidence-based rehabilitation, athlete education, and conservative, function-focused treatment plans.

history.event_update: Rowan Myles conducted an on-site reassessment of Sera Lortin at Brindemoor Aquatic Complex on the evening of 2025-08-04 (≈19:10 for ~25 minutes), documented ROM and resisted shoulder tests with a pain-on-load of 4/10, and issued a same-day written medical clearance (signed and dated) specifying provisional left subacromial tendinopathy, a two-week no-pool restriction, supervised rotator-cuff strengthening and twice-daily ice; his clearance and direct mobile number were included in Merrowgate's 20:03 email to the Federation.
